link.synopsis: A famous country singer bets that she can turn a thuggish cab driver into a polished performer in this comedy. Country star Jake Ferris (Dolly Parton) has her work cut out for her after she boasts she can turn the next person she meets into a talented country singer. Unfortunately for Ferris, the next person she meets is obnoxious cab driver Nick Martinelli (Sylvester Stallone). Richard Farnsworth, Ron Leibman and Tim Tomerson also star.
link.title: synopsis
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: In this hit HBO comedy series, Garry Shandling stars as Larry Sanders, the host of a late-night talk show. Larry brings the laughs for his television audience with help from his sidekick, Hank -- but Larry's private life behind the scenes is funnier.
link.title: synopsis
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
Glick Doesn't Do Red Carpet: Jiminy Glick at the Independent Spirit Awards
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
We Jam Econo: The Story of the Minutemen
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show
I Am Trying to Break Your Heart: A Film About Wilco
Who Is Harry Nilsson (And Why Is Everybody Talkin' About Him?)
Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work

link.synopsis: An all-star cast (including Paul Rudd, Winona Ryder, Jessica Alba, Oliver Platt, Liev Schreiber, Famke Janssen, Rob Corddry and Gretchen Mol, among others) appears in this collection of 10 irreverent tales inspired by the Ten Commandments. Nothing is sacred -- not even the sanctity of marriage -- in the humorous anthology written by Ken Marino and director David Wain, formerly of the comedy troupe the State.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Finding themselves strapped for cash, a British earl and his wife turn their mansion into a tourist attraction in this comedy of manners. When an American millionaire visits, he becomes smitten with the lady of the house.
link.title: synopsis

category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: I Was a Male War Bride
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: Recorded at Philadelphia's Comedy Factory Outlet, this uncensored performance by Andrew Dice Clay -- whose routines have covered everything from blind dates and one-night stands to marriage and morality -- will leave you shocked ... and laughing. With his lethal put-downs, vicious jokes and raunchy stand-up act, the controversial Clay has earned his bad-boy reputation -- along with a lifetime ban from MTV.

title.regular: Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
title.short: Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice

link.synopsis: In this action-comedy based on the 1980s-debuted TV show, Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum play youthful undercover cops who work the local high school. There to investigate a drug ring, the guys find that much has changed since their own school days.
link.title: synopsis
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way
G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, man-about-town Neal consents to an arranged marriage, with one condition: He gets to live it up in Vancouver before taking the plunge. But upon arriving, he crosses paths with ditsy waitress Nikki, who derails all his plans.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A caustic hand puppet bunny named Greg and his band of foul-mouthed furry friends spoof the world of independent film in this short-lived comedy series that garnered a loyal cult following. After a failed stint on Fox, the show reemerged on IFC.
link.title: synopsis
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Warrior of the Lost World
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Girl in Gold Boots
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Giant Gila Monster
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Manhunt in Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Corpse Vanishes
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Christopher Walken
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Secret Agent, Super Dragon
Mystery Science Theater 3000: I Accuse My Parents

link.synopsis: Although he loves his job as sports radio talk show host, Johnny (Matt Bush) promises to take a dull but high-paying position to satisfy his fiancée (Anna Wood). But when he falls for a free-spirited beauty (Kerry Bishé) in the Hamptons, Johnny starts to reconsider everything. Written, directed and co-starring Edward Burns, this romantic comedy explores the difficulty in choosing between one's duty and one's dreams.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When she learns she's in danger of losing her visa status and being deported, overbearing book editor Margaret Tate (Sandra Bullock, in a Golden Globe-nominated role) forces her put-upon assistant, Andrew Paxton (Ryan Reynolds), to marry her. Directed by Anne Fletcher (27 Dresses), this romantic comedy also stars Craig T. Nelson and Mary Steenburgen as Andrew's parents, Joe and Grace, and Betty White as the outspoken Grandma Annie.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason

link.synopsis: Outnumbered by a tribe of gun-toting Kiowa Indians, illiterate trapper Joe Bass (Burt Lancaster) reluctantly agrees to trade his furs for educated slave Joseph Lee (Ossie Davis). Bass and Lee track down the Indians to reclaim the furs, but Jim Howie (Telly Savalas) gets there first, nabs the furs, kidnaps Lee and heads to Mexico. Director Sydney Pollack fills this high-spirited Western comedy with slick camera work and sly social commentary.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

link.synopsis: When he learns that his karma will permit him to speak just a thousand more words before he dies, fast-talking agent Jack (Eddie Murphy) must make every syllable count to make peace with his wife, Caroline (Kerry Washington), and his celebrity author client, Dr. Sinja (Cliff Curtis). But can the man notorious for his idle flattery truly change his ways? Brian Robbins directs this comedy that co-stars Allison Janney, Ariel Winter and Clark Duke.
link.title: synopsis
The Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
I Think I Love My Wife
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Three friends (Diedrich Bader, Andrew Katos and Thomas Ian Nicholas of American Pie) open a bogus casting agency as part of a half-baked plan to help them meet beautiful women. But they get more than they bargained for when scores of would-be starlets show up. Jonathan Winters, Nicole Eggert (of "Charles in Charge" and "Baywatch" fame) and talk show host Chelsea Handler also star in this sexually charged National Lampoon comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A Lebanese beauty salon is the setting for this romantic comedy about five women and the various troubles they face, with director Nadine Labaki leading the cast as the shop's owner, Layale, who's heartbroken from a foundering affair.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
Ali Zaoua: Prince of the Streets

link.synopsis: Teenage best friends Keira St-George (Caroline Dhavernas), Lisa MacDougall (Holly Lewis) and Glory Lorraine (Amanda Walsh) have crushes on sexy but married Keith Clark (David Boreanaz) in this coming-of-age indie comedy. After discovering that Glory is sleeping with Keith, Keira and Lisa each seduce him, and soon all three are involved with him. Meanwhile, the exhausted Keith tires of providing stud service and begins to look for a way out.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Other Four Letter Words
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Looking to make their dreams come true, three friends move from Queens to a decrepit Harlem brownstone. But when they find themselves short on cash, they turn their residence into an unlicensed youth hostel to raise money for the rent. As an endless stream of oddballs seeks shelter in their house, the guys learn a few lessons about growing up. Ramon Rodriguez, Rafael Sardina, Steven Leon and Julissa Bermudez star in this indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend

link.synopsis: In this wild comedy, a vintage car and a virgin's virtue are at stake when best pals Jay (Christopher Wiehl) and Dewey (Alex Nesic) make a wager on the way to a friend's wedding. To win, faithful Jay must have a one-night stand while womanizer Dewey has to forgo sex for the weekend. But complications quickly ensue when Jay learns that the bride-to-be (Lisa Brenner) is his former high school sweetheart.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: After giving up on ever finding a mate, 40-year-old Joe (Randy Ryan) meets his dream girl , Amanda (Ariana Dubynin), and marries her. But when his new wife reveals a very deep, dark secret, Joe begins questioning the true meaning of love. Steve Marra writes and directs this unconventional romantic comedy that boldly challenges prevailing viewpoints on gender and affection. Amy Esacove, Doug Johnson and Faith Marie co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Ultimate Lesbian Short Film Festival

link.synopsis: Meet the McTeagues -- a hilariously funny, highly dysfunctional clan who all want a piece of their wealthy uncle's will. The only trouble is that he's not dead yet! Things quickly get out of hand, and soon the McTeagues are elevating back-stabbing and brown-nosing to new levels. Michael J. Fox, Kirk Douglas and Nancy Travis star in this "comedy of heirs."
link.title: synopsis
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
How to Beat the High Cost of Living

link.synopsis: Money can buy lots of things, but it can't always buy respect -- and that's a tough pill to swallow for impatient Karan and his friends, who move from Bombay to New York City to get rich quick in this Hindi thriller.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Funnyman Joey Medina (The Original Latin Kings of Comedy) hosts this hilarious stand-up showcase featuring some of the hottest Latino comics, who fuse urban and mainstream material for maximum effect. Featured comedians include headliners Willie Barcena (HBO's "Loco Slam"), Darren Carter (BET's "Comic View"), Alex Reymundo (HBO's "Bad Boys of Comedy") and Mike Robles (who hosts his own show, "Loco Comedy Jam").
link.title: synopsis
Macho Men and the Women Who Love Them
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Beats of the Heart: Salsa: Latin Pop Music in the Cities

Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Jo Koy: Don't Make Him Angry

link.synopsis: Pakistani pop singer Ali Zafar stars in this uncommon Bollywood comedy as an eager young reporter who moves to America to start a new life. But his poorly timed journey puts his arrival just after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: This buddy-action comedy mocks its genre. Actor Michael J. Fox needs to get under a cop's skin to research an upcoming role, and he picks an irritable New York City hard case (James Woods) as his source material. As if dealing with Fox weren't enough, the cop has a serial killer to catch. Fox soon learns that in the real world, you can't say "Cut."
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Kreton (Jerry Lewis), an impish creature from outer space, has an insatiable curiosity about humans and their ways. When he journeys to Earth and parks his spaceship in the backyard of Conrad (Earl Holliman), a skeptic who doesn't believe in aliens, both are in for big surprises. This classic sci-fi comedy is based on the successful 1957 Broadway play by Gore Vidal, who initially disagreed with the casting of Lewis in the lead role for the film.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee
category.term: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee

link.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
The Shakiest Gun in the West
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 6
Josh Kirby, Time Warrior: Human Pets

link.synopsis: Oscar-winner and comic chameleon Jamie Foxx plays host for the sixth installment of this popular Comedy Central series showcasing America's funniest black comedians. The lineup of cutting-edge talent includes Rudy Rush, Geoff Brown, Wil Sylvince, Isiah Kelly, Gerald Kelly, Benji Brown, Speedy and J.B. Smoove. If you want to see the next generation of urban quipsters at the top of their game, look no further.
link.title: synopsis

Diary of a Tired Black Man

link.synopsis: After moving back into their family's San Francisco mansion, sisters Prue, Piper and Phoebe discover an ancient text in the home's attic that reveals the latent supernatural powers they possess.
link.title: synopsis
The Nine Lives of Chloe King
Girls Just Want to Have Fun
The Secret Life of the American Teenager

link.synopsis: When a recently widowed Baptist preacher (Bill Toliver) loses the respect of his congregation over rumors of his impending marriage to a woman 45 years younger, best friends Kayla (Nadia Turner, "American Idol") and Jewels (Joe Clair, BET's "Rap City") hatch a plan to help him regain his flock. Director Shavar Ross leads an impressive cast in this comedy of faith and family, including Omar Gooding, Debra Wilson, Amentha Dymally and Al Jarreau.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Diary of a Tired Black Man
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Lord, All Men Can't Be Dogs
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Five on the Black Hand Side
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!
Jessica Sinclaire's Confessions of a Lonely Wife
Soweto Gospel Choir: Live at the Nelson Mandela Theatre
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me

link.synopsis: Comedian and Emmy-winning writer Dana Gould ("The Simpsons") gives his hilarious take on life's many ironies and absurdities in this comedy special recorded live at The Second City, Chicago's famed comedy theatre. From the panic attack known as parenthood to the challenges of marriage, Gould pokes fun at the every day and the imagined, including the trials and tribulations of diaper-clad astronauts and a family of sex toy factory workers.

link.synopsis: Follow the adventures of Scotland Yard's Serious and Organised Crime Group Commander, Clare Blake, as she starts an affair with a recently released murderer, cares for her cancer-stricken sister and searches for London's most dangerous killers.
link.title: synopsis
P.D. James: Shroud for a Nightingale
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: For the Sake of Elena
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: Missing Joseph

P.D. James: Death of an Expert Witness

link.synopsis: Set in a post-apocalyptic future where humans have been banished to depressed nomadic communities, this anime series follows a talented but mysterious young fighter named Layfon, who enrolls in a military academy. But it soon becomes clear that Layfon's skills are far more advanced than those of the other students, which he uses to help his schoolmates battle the Contaminoids, an alien race that now rules the planet.
link.title: synopsis
Jyu-Oh-Sei: Planet of the Beast King

link.synopsis: After crash-landing in Los Angeles' mundane San Fernando Valley, three colorful aliens (Jeff Goldblum, Jim Carrey and Damon Wayans) befriend manicurist Valerie (Geena Davis) and her wacky boss (Julie Brown), who give the threesome makeovers and show them the town in this zany comedy from director Julien Temple. When one of the aliens sweeps Valerie off her feet, she must choose between her unusual extraterrestrial lover and her unfaithful fiancé.
link.title: synopsis
The Favor, the Watch and the Very Big Fish

link.synopsis: Tommy Tiernan, a comedy superstar in his native Ireland, makes his U.S. television debut with this hilarious performance featuring his trademark combination of politically incorrect humor and uncensored tales about sex, family and religion.
link.title: synopsis
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, womanizing TV weatherman Taylor Worth sets out to prove he's utterly irresistible to women, making a bet with his buddies that he can get engaged to three beautiful ladies within three months.
link.title: synopsis
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: In this 1980 cult comedy, a group of rebellious teens tear up Beverly Hills on Halloween night 1965 to protest the demise of their favorite hangout, a drive-in marked for destruction by the snooty city bureaucracy. The gang -- which includes Tony Danza, Michelle Pfeiffer and Robert Wuhl in their first major film roles -- leaves its mark when the teens deface a high school banner, sabotage a police car and use a punch bowl as a toilet bowl.
link.title: synopsis
Take This Job and Shove It

link.synopsis: After spontaneously wedding a beauty (Virna Lisi) he'd just met, a cartoonist (Jack Lemmon) fantasizes about getting out of the hasty marriage by plotting his wife's murder in his sketchbook. But will life imitate art when she vanishes and the police show up on his doorstep? A product of a more chauvinistic era, this silly, less-than-politically-correct comedy is elevated by Lemmon's brilliant comic timing and Italian bombshell Lisi's considerable assets.
link.title: synopsis
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
I Was a Male War Bride
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
The Last Time I Saw Paris

link.synopsis: Let America Laugh is a video tour diary from comedian David Cross's 2002 tour (the same tour on which his smash-hit comedy album "Shut Up, You F***ing Baby!" was recorded). Hijinks and hilarity ensue as we follow Cross on the road, where he interacts with family, friends, fans, promoters, interviewers and many others using the gentle, nurturing brand of humor (not!) for which he's internationally known and loved.
link.title: synopsis
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey

Lord, Save Us from Your Followers

link.synopsis: As 19th-century grave robber Arthur Blake faces the guillotine, he confesses his sins to a priest, revealing a life filled with unearthly high jinks in this macabre comedy starring Dominic Monaghan as the doomed digger and Ron Perlman as the cleric.
link.title: synopsis
Masters of Horror: John Landis: Family
Masters of Horror: Stuart Gordon: Dreams in the Witch House

link.synopsis: Director Willard Carroll's romantic comedy stars Ali Larter as prickly American actress Marigold Lexton, who gets stranded in India when her luggage is lost and her picture is shelved. She literally lands on her feet, though, after accepting a part in a Bollywood musical -- the only problem is, Marigold can't dance. But the film's choreographer (Salman Khan) soon transforms her into a hoofer … while teaching her a few other lessons along the way.
link.title: synopsis
Beats of the Heart: There'll Always Be Stars in the Sky: The Indian Film Music Phenomenon

link.synopsis: This sweet-natured spoof of Bollywood romantic comedies recounts the ups and downs of cynical assistant director Jay, who loathes romance, and designer Simran, who adores all things sentimental. They meet cute, but will they fall in love?
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Young Shakespeare (Joseph Fiennes) is forced to stage his latest comedy, "Romeo and Ethel, the Pirate's Daughter," before it's even written. When a lovely noblewoman (Gwyneth Paltrow) auditions for a role, they fall into forbidden love -- and his play finds a new life (and title). As their relationship progresses, Shakespeare's comedy soon transforms into tragedy. This bittersweet romance won seven Oscars, including Best Picture and Best Actress.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.synopsis: Written, directed and produced by John Wells ("The West Wing"), this indie drama stars Ben Affleck as a successful businessman who comes face-to-face with America's downsizing epidemic when he loses his job and is forced to take a construction gig. Rounding out the all-star cast are Kevin Costner as Affleck's brother-in-law, Tommy Lee Jones as a conflicted corporate bigwig and Chris Cooper as a paranoid executive.
link.title: synopsis
The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada
It's Kind of a Funny Story
Precious: Based on the Novel Push by Sapphire

link.synopsis: The kicks and twists come fast in this wild comedy about three lovely community college cheerleaders and martial arts crime fighters who must rescue their sensei from crooks and still keep their GPA high enough to transfer to an Ivy League school.
link.title: synopsis
Operation Condor 2: Armour of the Gods

link.synopsis: Inspired by archaeologist Michael Coe's best-selling book, this fascinating documentary traces the extraordinary efforts to decode a writing system that has mystified historians for centuries: the hieroglyphic script of the ancient Mayans. Eleven years in the making, David Lebrun's film journeys from one end of the world to the other to explore the epic story behind one of the greatest scientific discoveries of the 20th century.
link.title: synopsis
Lost King of the Maya: Nova
National Geographic: Dawn of the Maya
National Geographic: The Great Inca Rebellion
2012: Mayan Prophecy and the Shift of the Ages
National Geographic: Into the Great Pyramid
National Geographic: Nefertiti and the Lost Dynasty
National Geographic: Egypt: Secrets of the Pharaohs
Ancient Mysteries: The Hidden City of Petra
National Geographic: King Tut's Final Secrets
Ancient Mysteries: Astrology: Secrets in the Stars
Ancient Mysteries: UFOs: The First Encounters
National Geographic: Egypt Eternal: The Quest for Lost Tombs
National Geographic: The Human Family Tree
Secrets of the Dead: Silver Pharaoh
National Geographic: Beyond the Movie: The New World: Nightmare in Jamestown
In Search of History: The Knights Templar

link.synopsis: Keanu Reeves stars in this dark comedy as Henry, an affable tollbooth worker in Buffalo, N.Y., who finds himself on the wrong end of justice when he's accused and convicted of a bank robbery that he didn't commit. After getting some advice from an old convict (James Caan) while spending time in the clink, Henry hatches a daring scheme of his own. Vera Farmiga, Judy Greer and Peter Stormare co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Harry and Walter Go to New York

link.synopsis: Changing fortunes await wealthy but dejected industrialist Aditya (Shahid Kapoor) when he meets a spirited chatterbox named Geet (Kareena Kapoor) on a train in this breezy romantic comedy from Bollywood director Imtiaz Ali. Nursing a broken heart, Aditya ends up traveling with the impulsive Geet, who's on her way to elope with her secret beau. But fate has other plans, and soon Geet and Aditya are thrust together again ... perhaps for keeps.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Hardworking housewife Pat Kramer (Lily Tomlin) gets that "shrinking" feeling after she is exposed to a mix of household chemicals that slowly and steadily make her smaller and smaller, much to the concern of her kids and her ad exec husband (Charles Grodin). It isn't long before a team of goons plots to kidnap Pat so they can study her condition and inflict it on the rest of the human population, in this visually captivating family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
Girls Just Want to Have Fun
The Brady Bunch in the White House
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: This controversial film explores the consequences of a young Mormon missionary, Aaron (Steve Sandvoss), recognizing his homosexuality and falling in love with another man. Aaron's first sexual encounter with a gay "party boy" (Wesley A. Ramsey) leads to a passionate romance that gets Aaron excommunicated from his church and risks destroying both their lives. Charming and sexy, Latter Days offers a heady mix of romantic comedy and powerful drama.
link.title: synopsis
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
The Best of Boys in Love
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them 2

link.synopsis: Grad student Sara Quinn (Julianne Nicholson) is perplexed by her endless string of romantic failures. Combining work on an anthropological dissertation with her quest for personal answers, Sara interviews an array of men, whose confessions range from banal to bizarre. Actor John Krasinski makes his directorial debut with this quirky comedy based on a collection of short stories by David Foster Wallace.
link.title: synopsis
A Complete History of My Sexual Failures
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
How to Be a Serial Killer

link.synopsis: Executive-produced by consummate funnyman Martin Lawrence, this rollicking series showcases some of the edgiest stand-up comics in the business, who take comedy and good taste to the limit -- all in pursuit of laughs.
link.title: synopsis
Martin Lawrence Presents: 1st Amendment Standup: Season 2
Martin Lawrence Presents: 1st Amendment Standup: Season 3
Martin Lawrence Presents: 1st Amendment Standup: Season 4
Martin Lawrence Presents: 1st Amendment Standup: Season 5
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!
Mo'Nique: I Coulda Been Your Cellmate!
Jamie Foxx: I Might Need Security
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Donnell Rawlings: From Ashy to Classy
R. Kelly Live! The Light It Up Tour
Earthquake Presents: From the Outhouse to the White House
Live Comedy from the Laff House: Kevin Hart
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Patrice O'Neal: Elephant in the Room
Diplomats & Friends: The Book of Hip-Hop
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip

link.synopsis: After saving each other from jumping off a bridge, Henry Bell (Sam Neill) and Karen Knightly (Helena Bonham Carter) plot to avenge the people who drove them to suicide. Henry will ruin the life of the woman (Kristin Scott Thomas) who married Karen's boyfriend, while Karen will work as a secretary for the man (Steve Coogan) who took Henry's job. Whether revenge will be sweet -- or bittersweet -- is anyone's guess.
link.title: synopsis
The Favor, the Watch and the Very Big Fish

link.synopsis: Plucky paper pusher Sarah Jane McKinney (Leslie Bibb) lands a great promotion after innocently killing her boss, Milo Beeber (Brandon Routh), and soon she's employing her talent for treachery to scale the Judge Pharmaceuticals ladder. In this black comedy, the executives drop like flies as Sarah Jane beats a path to the confessional of Father Grisham (Barry Bostwick). But the game gets dicey when she falls for cop Bill Malloy (Adam Goldberg).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Raúl Esparza stars in this 2006 revival of Stephen Sondheim's Tony Award-winning musical comedy recorded live for PBS's "Great Performances" and featuring the classics "Side by Side by Side," "The Ladies Who Lunch" and "Another Hundred People." Celebrating his 35th birthday among married friends, swinging Manhattan bachelor Bobby (Esparza) considers the value of a committed relationship. John Doyle directs this celebrated production.
link.title: synopsis
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
A Wayfarer's Journey: Listening to Mahler
Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work
Eating Out: All You Can Eat

link.synopsis: Host Mike Nelson continues the cultish comedy cavalcade of biting sarcastic humor that can only be "Mystery Science Theater 3000." This time out, the boys take on the low-budget horror flick The Touch of Satan. When a lost traveler is taken in by a beautiful woman, he falls in love. But when he finds out she's sporting a mean -- and sharp -- pitchfork, he learns she's not exactly the girl of his dreams.
link.title: synopsis
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Final Sacrifice
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Monster a Go-Go
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Incredibly Strange Creatures Who Stopped Living and Became Mixed-Up Zombies
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Corpse Vanishes
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Crawling Eye
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Giant Gila Monster
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Gaos
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Girl in Gold Boots
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Secret Agent, Super Dragon
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Blood Waters of Dr. Z
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Rebel Set
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Red Zone Cuba
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Manhunt in Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Night of the Blood Beast
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Zigra
Mystery Science Theater 3000: I Accuse My Parents
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Guiron
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Barugon
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Beginning of the End
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Atomic Brain
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Warrior of the Lost World
Doctor Who: The City of Death
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret

title.regular: Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Touch of Satan

link.synopsis: The great Simon Yuen Siu Tin, who played Jackie Chan's master in the groundbreaking film Drunken Master, leads a talented cast in this comedy about the legend of drunken kung fu masters. Fan Ta Pei and Su Hua Tzu are winery workers who've been taught martial arts by their employer so they can confront a local bully. Filled with marvelous fights that showcase the famous Drunken Fist!
link.title: synopsis
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power
Dr. Wai in the Scripture with No Words
Shaolin Ulysses: Kung Fu Monks in America
Zu: Warriors From The Magic Mountain

link.synopsis: Armed with a mix of tried-and-true police skills and the latest advances in forensic technology, modern criminologists sift through a backlog of unsolved crimes, dissecting cases that have stumped experts for years. Television journalist Bill Kurtis hosts this groundbreaking A&E series that takes viewers behind the scenes on a thrilling hunt for uncaught killers who figured they'd never be found.
link.title: synopsis
Cold Case Files: The Most Infamous Cases
Aileen Wuornos: The Selling of a Serial Killer
James Ellroy's LA: City of Demons
Aileen: Life and Death of a Serial Killer
The Power of Forgiveness: The Story of Karla Faye Tucker
H.H. Holmes: America's First Serial Killer
Frontline: The Dancing Boys of Afghanistan
Trained in the Ways of Men
Psychic Kids: Children of the Paranormal

title.regular: Cold Case Files: The Most Infamous Cases
title.short: Cold Case Files: The Most Infamous Cases

link.synopsis: In a bid to jump-start his flagging career, a hapless songwriter (Henry Phillips) moves to L.A., where through a stroke of dumb luck, he lands a record deal. But show biz is a fickle mistress, and that luck soon turns when he becomes the victim of a vicious rumor. Winner of the Audience Award at the Slamdance Film Festival, this indie comedy -- directed by Gregori Viens -- co-stars Ellen Ratner and Matthew Walker.
link.title: synopsis
I Am Trying to Break Your Heart: A Film About Wilco
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
The Myth of the American Sleepover
Who Is Harry Nilsson (And Why Is Everybody Talkin' About Him?)
Buy the Ticket, Take the Ride
Classic Albums: U2: The Joshua Tree

link.synopsis: From the producer of the Police Academy films comes this screwball comedy about a ski patrol team who guards the snowy slopes belonging to Pops (Ray Walston), a lovable resort owner whose livelihood is being threatened by greedy developer Sam Maris (Martin Mull). While thwarting Maris's attempts to sabotage the lodge's inspection, the misfit crew frolics with sexy ski bunnies and keeps the mountain safe from careless daredevils.
link.title: synopsis
Warren Miller's: The Power of Snow: Cold Fusion
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood
Take This Job and Shove It

link.synopsis: After getting together for a calamitous one-night stand in the 1980s, single homosexuals Adam (Craig Chester) and Steve (Malcolm Gets) don't see each other again until they cross paths 17 years later. In an unbelievable twist, it takes a year of dating for Adam and Steve to realize they've already met, which complicates their romance even further. Parker Posey, Chris Kattan and Sally Kirkland provide first-rate support in this snappy comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them
The Best of Boys in Love

link.synopsis: New York City funnyman George Carlin, once (obviously) considered the class clown as a child, goes back to school in this smart and hilarious performance recorded at the University of California in Los Angeles. Carlin's 1984 show includes a collection of some of his most famous satirical comedy routines, such as "A Place for My Stuff," "The Prayer" "Consumer Hints" and more. Also included are award-winning animated shorts.
link.title: synopsis
George Carlin: Playing with Your Head
George Carlin: What Am I Doing in New Jersey?
George Carlin: Jammin' in New York
George Carlin: On Location With George Carlin
George Carlin: You are All Diseased
George Carlin: Life Is Worth Losing
Sam Kinison: Why Did We Laugh?
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
Christopher Titus: The 5th Annual End of the World Tour
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle

link.synopsis: Comedy superstars Adam Sandler, Chris Rock, Rob Schneider, David Spade and Kevin James team up for a story of five childhood pals who reunite after 30 years to mourn the loss of their old basketball coach. Gathering at a July 4th celebration where their families meet for the first time, the friends find themselves acting a bit inappropriate for their age. Director Dennis Dugan pairs with frequent collaborator Sandler, who co-wrote the screenplay.
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Superman/Shazam!: The Return of Black Adam
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion

link.synopsis: In the wake of her husband's death, newly widowed pioneer woman Marty (Katherine Heigl) tries to survive life on the open range by heeding the advice of friends (Corbin Bernsen and Theresa Russell), marrying a man (Dale Midkiff) she doesn't love and caring for his child (Skye McCole Bartusiak). Marty plans to stay until the spring -- but when it comes time to move on, things don't turn out as she expected.
link.title: synopsis
James Patterson's Suzanne's Diary for Nicholas
The Note II: Taking a Chance on Love
Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood
The Catherine Cookson Anthology: Colour Blind
When a Man Loves a Woman
Diary of a Mad Black Woman

link.synopsis: Jason Priestly stars in this scripted comedy as the titular Richard "Fitz" Fitzpatrick, an unscrupulous used car salesman who narrowly survives a near-death experience and comes face-to-face with his alter ego.
link.title: synopsis
The Worst Week of My Life

link.synopsis: When her longtime fiancé (Ji-seob So) abruptly dumps her for a sexy but selfish movie star (Bingbing Fan), comic book artist Sophie (Ziyi Zhang, from Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon) teams with the snarky starlet's own former lover (Peter Ho) in a ploy to win back the heart of her beau in this romantic comedy. Hoping to inspire other jilted women, Sophie prints her adventures in her comics -- until her scheme utterly unravels. Yimeng Jin directs.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: During Japanese colonial rule in Korea, a legendary 3,000-carat diamond is set to be transported to Japan by the military. But their mission is complicated by thieves who are also after the priceless gem in this heist comedy-adventure.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Seoul
The Good, the Bad, the Weird
Woman Is the Future of Man

title.regular: Once Upon a Time in Corea
title.short: Once Upon a Time in Corea

link.synopsis: Romance beckons for six Seoul natives who journey to an island paradise south of Manila. Fugitive pop star Ga-young (Eugene) finds an unlikely bond with dorky Jung-hwan (Min-ki Lee), while free spirit Soo-jin (Soo-kyung Lee) pierces the armor of stern CEO Jae-hyuk (Sang-soo Hong). The story of suicidal loser Joong-shik (Mun-shik Lee) ties the disparate tales together in this amusing romantic comedy from South Korean director Chul-woo Kang.
link.title: synopsis
Woman Is the Future of Man
The Virgin Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors

link.synopsis: Moscow Circus saxophone player Vladimir Ivanoff (Robin Williams) defects in Bloomingdale's while on tour in New York City. Befriended and temporarily housed by security guard Lionel Witherspoon (Cleavant Derricks), Vladimir experiences many misadventures -- and a longing for his family. But his loneliness is soon lifted by lovely Lucia (Maria Conchita Alonso). Paul Mazursky directs this Golden Globe-nominated comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: All or Nothing: A Moscow Detour
The Man with One Red Shoe
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
In the Time of the Butterflies

link.synopsis: Self-proclaimed executive transvestite and comedian Eddie Izzard brings his stand-up act to the Apollo Theater in Labatt. With topics including the nature of God, the search for a career, classical mythology and Scooby-Doo, Izzard presents intellectual and fast-paced comedy. His imitations include Sean Connery, whom he imagines playing Noah trying to convince God that a speedboat would be a better photo opportunity than an ark.
link.title: synopsis
A Wink and a Smile: The Art of Burlesque
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Christopher Walken
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
Bob & Tom: Comedy All Stars Tour
Russell Brand in New York City
Kevin Nealon: Now Hear Me Out!
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dan Aykroyd
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show

link.synopsis: In this gleefully low-rent action-comedy, hefty half-vampire Blubberella sets her always-ravenous sights on a Nazi leader who's concocting a diabolical plan: to create an army of undead soldiers to help his Führer conquer the globe.
link.title: synopsis
In the Name of the King 2: Two Worlds
In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
The Good, the Bad, the Weird
Citizen Toxie: The Toxic Avenger IV

link.synopsis: Patrick Sayre directs this coming-of-age comedy about four adolescent buddies (Logan Manus, Mario Cassem, Jesse Stevenson and Rashad Monson) whose raging hormones zero in on the sexy mother (Brittney Powell) of their cute friend Stacy (Haley Fite). As each boy tries to win the older woman's affections, he gets his first lesson in heartbreak. The cast also includes Dennis Haskins, Lisa Lynch and Joey Diaz.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Snoop Dogg narrates this explosive satire that skewers the 1992 Los Angeles riots and roasts everyone from Mayor Bradley (Charles S. Dutton) to LAPD Chief Darryl Gates (Ronny Cox). From the Rodney King beating to the trial and the rising social and ethnic tensions that eventually ignite into violent chaos, this comedy blazes down the politically incorrect freeway at top speed. Emilio Estevez, William Forsythe and George Hamilton co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Five on the Black Hand Side
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend

link.synopsis: This documentary combines black comedy and serious historical research to examine how the marketing of fundamentalist Christianity has evolved over the years, including televangelism, megachurches and the post-Sept. 11 battle for moral superiority.
link.title: synopsis
Freedom Fries: And Other Stupidity We'll Have to Explain to Our Grandchildren
Lord, Save Us from Your Followers
God in America: How Religious Liberty Shaped America
Wal-Mart: The High Cost of Low Price
Flight from Death: The Quest for Immortality
For the Bible Tells Me So
Boogie Man: The Lee Atwater Story
The Best Government Money Can Buy?
Secrets of the Dead: Lost in the Amazon
Bush Family Fortunes: The Best Democracy Money Can Buy
This Film Is Not Yet Rated

link.synopsis: Written and directed by Ross Clendenen (who also stars) and Paul Hawley, this delicious mockumentary takes dead aim at the pretentious would-be connoisseurs of Northern California's winemaking community. While preparing for the annual Golden Harvest Gala, four groups of rival vintners are sent into a tizzy when they learn that a celebrated wine critic is scheduled to judge the festival's wine competition.
link.title: synopsis
To Market to Market to Buy a Fat Pig
Empires of Industry: Brewed in America
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
El Superstar: The Unlikely Rise of Juan Frances
The Killing of a Chinese Cookie

link.synopsis: Murphy's Law is an ongoing theme in this quirky BBC comedy series that finds seemingly cursed couple Howard and Mel in the midst of premarital chaos -- and, later on, in the throes of labor pains.
link.title: synopsis
The Worst Week of My Life: Series 1
The Worst Week of My Life: Series 2
The Worst Week of My Life: Series 3
A Film with Me in It

title.regular: The Worst Week of My Life
title.short: The Worst Week of My Life

link.synopsis: In this darkly comic farce from Joel Coen and Ethan Coen, an ousted CIA official (John Malkovich) loses his penned memoir to a pair of moronic gym employees (Brad Pitt and Frances McDormand, in a Golden Globe-nominated role) who use it to try and turn a profit. George Clooney and Tilda Swinton round out the cast of this irreverent tale of poorly executed espionage, which also earned a Golden Globe nod for Best Picture (Comedy).
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Men Who Stare at Goats

link.synopsis: After years of honing his comic craft in clubs all over the country and appearing on some of the hottest radio and television shows, Drew Hastings takes the spotlight in his first full-length comedy special. Pacing the stage in his famous horn-rimmed glasses, Ohio native Hastings offers a unique, Midwestern take on life, love and even his own ill-fated efforts at farming. Find out why "The Tonight Show" audience gave him a rare standing ovation.
link.title: synopsis
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing
Bob & Tom Radio: The Comedy Tour
Bob & Tom: Comedy All Stars Tour
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
Kevin Nealon: Now Hear Me Out!
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole

link.synopsis: Madea adds some "Hallelujer!" to the holidays in this family comedy that finds her helping a high-class brood in Cape Cod at Christmastime. Can Madea pull off a Christmas miracle and get everyone to truly appreciate all they have?
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Laugh to Keep from Crying
Tyler Perry: What's Done in the Dark
I Can Do Bad All By Myself
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Celebration of Gospel: Taking You Higher
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play
Diary of a Mad Black Woman
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

link.synopsis: Real-life twin brothers and skateboarding phenoms Nic Puehse and Tristan Puehse share the spotlight in this kid-friendly comedy that finds them trying to save their parents' marriage in time to win the Mega Dega skateboarding competition. They've got the talent to pull both things off. But with a security guard on their tails and new obstacles popping up around every turn, it's going to take luck and pluck.
link.title: synopsis
And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird
For the Love of a Dog
The Mystical Adventures of Billy Owens

title.regular: Nic and Tristan Go Mega Dega
title.short: Nic and Tristan Go Mega Dega

link.synopsis: In this droll comedy series, a pair of middle-aged singles who are leery of romance -- prickly translator Laura Dalton and rumpled gardener Michael Selway -- dodge and weave their way to friendship and, ultimately, love.
link.title: synopsis
Agatha Christie's Tommy & Tuppence: Partners in Crime
The Worst Week of My Life
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: For the Sake of Elena
A Dance to the Music of Time
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun

link.synopsis: In this madcap comedy from director Monty Banks, stars Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy join the Army to protect their rich cosseted master, Dan Forrester (Dick Nelson), who's just been drafted. Zaniness ensues when Stan and Ollie follow Dan to boot camp, where he romances camera store owner Ginger Hammond (Sheila Ryan) -- who may be a fortune hunter. Mae Marsh and Ethel Griffies play Dan's mollycoddling aunts, and Alan Ladd turns up in a bit part.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Time I Saw Archie
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Return of the Pink Panther
What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Bombarded by stress from her dead-end job, attention-starved family and never-ending household duties, weary working mother Rita (Nicole Sullivan) reclaims her individuality by rocking out with her best friend (Tisha Campbell-Martin) and her daughter's boyfriend (Ricky Ullman) in a garage band. Throughout this comedy series, Rita must face uncomfortable challenges, including arguments with her kids, a visit from her mother and another pregnancy.
link.title: synopsis
The Worst Week of My Life

link.synopsis: When big-time Mexican movie producer Alejandro Mateos (Julio Bracho) launches a nationwide talent search to cast the leading lady in his new film, four conniving would-be actresses scheme to get the part. As they try to elbow each other out the way, they must also contend with the producer's volatile girlfriend, Eva (Patricia Llaca), who wants the role for herself. Issa López directs this comedy that co-stars Maya Zapata and Ana Layevska.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This family-friendly comedy charts the heartwarming journey of Gordon Glass, a would-be actor working as a security guard while waiting for his big break. As Gordon gets closer to his dream, he has an oddly encouraging effect on those in his orbit.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
You Got Served: Beat the World

link.synopsis: In Iranian director Abbas Kiarostami's captivating meditation on art and love, British writer James Miller meets a beautiful gallery owner in Tuscany and begins -- or possibly continues -- a romance with her.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Preparing for their dream wedding, Alberto and Susana patiently endure the dramas of their best friends, Lea and Ernesto -- until Ernesto is misdiagnosed with a fatal disease … and his dying wish is to sleep with Susana. The couple now wavers between their natural instincts to deny the indecent proposal and their desire to fulfill the unexpected hopes and dreams of their fated friend in this fast-paced comedy of errors from Spain.
link.title: synopsis
ESL: English as a Second Language

link.synopsis: It's punk rock meets Animal House in this campus comedy that stars Ben Affleck as Jack, a soon-to-be graduate who finds he's having a difficult time letting go of the college life -- and decides maybe he doesn't have to. Also questioning whether there's life after college are Jack's roommates: Rob, who fears domestication; comic-strip artist Mickey, who's shy around girls; intellectual party animal Slosh; and perpetual student Dennis.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Diagnosed with terminal cancer, otherwise typical teen Dylan Jamieson (Michael Angarano) appears on a local TV show -- courtesy of a charity that grants wishes to dying kids -- and makes an unusual last request: a date with hot supermodel Nikki Sinclaire (Sunny Mabrey). But Dylan may be in for a disappointment when he learns that his dream babe isn't so pretty on the inside. Cynthia Nixon co-stars in director Alex Steyermark's bittersweet comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: While an elite pair of New York City cops (Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson and Samuel L. Jackson) nabs headlines for their amazing heroics, fellow boys in blue Allen (Will Ferrell) and Terry (Mark Wahlberg) toil in obscurity as lowly desk jockeys, until a big break finally gives them a chance to tackle real police work. Rob Riggle, Eva Mendes, Michael Keaton and Steve Coogan co-star in this action-packed comedy directed by Adam McKay.
link.title: synopsis
Return to the Bat Cave: The Misadventures of Adam and Burt
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby

link.synopsis: Down-on-his-luck detective Ray Pluto is humiliated when a back injury prevents him from stopping a murder at a fast-food restaurant, and a 6-year-old saves the day instead. This offbeat comedy finds Pluto trying to bounce back from rock-bottom.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Social worker Rae Carter finds her preconceptions about love and romance shattered when she and her longtime boyfriend break up in this comedy. Rae shortly begins seeing a new beau, who quickly proposes -- just as her ex is having second thoughts.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When his father opts to sell the family vacation house in the Hamptons, a sophomoric 30-year-old (Jason Sudeikis) realizes the home's tradition of summer parties will soon end. So he decides to go out with a bang -- with many bangs, actually -- by throwing an orgy. Enlisting the help of his best pals, he sets out to make the dream a reality in this rowdy comedy, also starring Will Forte, Lake Bell, Leslie Bibb and Michelle Borth.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Be Afraid of the Dark
Lost Reality 2: More of the Worst

link.synopsis: When the manager of a retirement home in the Irish countryside asks her younger sister, Ellie (Hayley Atwell), to run the facility during the holidays, four mischievous residents take advantage of the power vacuum and turn the place upside down. As Ellie learns to take charge, the residents also come to terms with their own troubles. Anthony Byrne directs this heartwarming comedy-drama co-starring Joss Ackland and Vanessa Redgrave.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
A Thousand Years of Good Prayers

link.synopsis: When he learns that his mother is on the verge of deserting his father for a dance instructor, young Welsh teen Oliver (Craig Roberts) resolves to do whatever it takes to save his parents' marriage before the end of summer. Meanwhile, the offbeat lad also schemes to seduce pushy pyromaniac Jordana (Yasmin Paige) with nothing but the power of his mind. Richard Ayoade directs this quirky coming-of-age comedy based on a novel by Joe Dunthorne.
link.title: synopsis
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: The lovelorn teenagers of "School Rumble" are back in this collection that explores parallel story lines from the romantic comedy series, in which Yoshidayama reflects on his troubled past, the whole gang is transported back in time, and more.
link.title: synopsis
Eden of the East the Movie I: The King of Eden

link.synopsis: In a bid to spark an Internet romance with the hunky Zack, nerdy Casey (Daniel Skelton) fudges his online profile by using a photo of his friend Tiffani's (Rebekah Kochan) hot -- but straight -- ex-boyfriend Ryan (Michael E.R. Walker). Great idea ... until Ryan appears in the flesh. Mink Stole adds to the shenanigans as Casey's eccentric but lovable Aunt Helen and Leslie Jordan appears as Casey's mentor in this wacky comedy of love and lust.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of Boys in Love

title.regular: Eating Out: All You Can Eat
title.short: Eating Out: All You Can Eat

link.synopsis: Linda (Diana Marquis), the successful daughter of Cuban immigrants, has vowed to keep her Latino heritage at a distance. She's also vowed to stay away from all Latino men, choosing instead the passionless, self-absorbed Steve (Christopher Marazzo). But Linda's plans change when she meets charming firefighter Jose (Juan Carlos Hernandez), who introduces her to a world of Latin passion in this romantic comedy from Maria Escobedo.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
Love and Other Four Letter Words

link.synopsis: Tim Conrad's (Paul Rudd) boss hosts a dinner party where he invites his friends to bring along the saddest, most pathetic loser they can find. But when the ultimate schmuck (Steve Carell) arrives, his actions somehow turn everyone else into the losers. Comic heavy hitters Zach Galifianakis and Ron Livingston lend able support in director Jay Roach's (Austin Powers) darkly humorous film, an adaptation of the French comedy The Dinner Game.
link.title: synopsis
Comedians of Comedy: Live at the Troubadour
It's Kind of a Funny Story
I Could Never Be Your Woman

link.synopsis: Suffering from a severe case of depression, toy company CEO Walter Black begins using a beaver hand puppet to help him open up to his family. Jodie Foster directs and co-stars as Walter's wife in this dark comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?

link.synopsis: Winner of four Oscars -- including Best Picture and Best Actress -- director Woody Allen's iconic romantic comedy charts the relationship between neurotic writer Alvy Singer and quirky aspiring singer Annie Hall.

link.synopsis: When the identities of secret agents from Control are compromised, the Chief (Alan Arkin) promotes hapless but eager analyst Maxwell Smart (Steve Carell) and teams him with stylish, capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), the only spy whose cover remains intact. Can they work together to thwart the evil plans of KAOS and its crafty operative (Terence Stamp)? Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson co-stars in this comedy caper based on the classic television show.

link.synopsis: In this comedy based on the semi-biographical stories of Hunter S. Thompson, the gonzo journalist (Bill Murray) stumbles through a series of wacky adventures (some true, some imagined) from 1968 to 1972 -- often with his attorney, Carl Lazlo (Peter Boyle), by his side. Fueled by drugs, Wild Turkey and firearms, Thompson covers the Super Bowl and the 1972 presidential election, and even takes a side trip that terrifies an unsuspecting hitchhiker.
